    "for each odd prime @xmath17 we have a formal hecke operator @xmath18\\rightarrow z/2[[x]]$ ] taking @xmath19 to @xmath20 ; these operators commute .",
    "let @xmath21 be @xmath2 , @xmath22 odd and @xmath23 , and let @xmath24 be the subspace of @xmath1 $ ] spanned by @xmath21 , @xmath25 , @xmath26 , @xmath27 , @xmath28 .",
    "nicolas and serre @xcite , @xcite have shown that each @xmath8 stabilizes @xmath24 , and they have analyzed the action on @xmath24 of the algebra generated by the maps @xmath29 . in their analysis they make @xmath24 into a @xmath30$]-module with @xmath31 and @xmath32 acting by @xmath15 and @xmath16 .",
    "they show that under this action @xmath24 is the matlis dual of @xmath30 $ ] , and that each @xmath29 is a power series with zero constant term in @xmath33 and @xmath34 .",
    "@xmath24 is in fact the space of `` mod 2 modular forms of level 1 '' ( or more accurately the set of odd power series in that space ) , and the nicolas - serre results are fundamental to the study of such forms .",
    "these results depend on two technical lemmas , stated as propositions 4.3 and 4.4 of @xcite , with unpublished proofs .",
    "gerbelli - gauthier has recently found a sensible proof of proposition 4.3 . combining her argument with some facts concerning certain binary theta - series ,",
    "i ve succeeded in simplifying the arguments of nicolas and serre considerably  an exposition is in preparation .",
    "i ll now describe the results of this note , which are related to the hecke action on the space of `` mod 2 modular form for @xmath35 '' .",
    "[ def1.1 ] @xmath0 in @xmath1 $ ] is @xmath2 , where @xmath36 and @xmath3 .",

    "we ll interpret @xmath5 as a subquotient of @xmath45 , and use this interpretation to show that if @xmath9 then @xmath48 is a sum of @xmath6 with @xmath49 and @xmath50 .",
    "this will allow us to make @xmath38 and @xmath39 into @xmath30$]-modules with @xmath31 and @xmath32 acting by @xmath10 and @xmath11 .",
    "an argument identical in essence to that of gerbelli - gauthier then gives an analogue , for the action of @xmath31 on @xmath39 , to the nicolas - serre proposition 4.3 . in section [ section3 ]",
    "we turn to the theory of binary theta series , using it to construct a `` dihedral space '' , contained in @xmath39 and annihilated by @xmath31 , on which the action of @xmath32 can be easily described .    in the final sections we use the results above , first establishing results for @xmath39 , @xmath10 and @xmath11 completely analogous to the nicolas - serre results for @xmath24 , @xmath15 and @xmath16 .",
    "there s a surprise though when we turn to @xmath5 , which is stabilized by all the @xmath8 , @xmath9 .",

    "fix a power , @xmath69 , of 2 . in this section",
    "we ( essentially ) use binary quadratic forms of discriminant @xmath323 to construct a subspace , @xmath324 , of @xmath39 of dimension @xmath69 , stable under the @xmath8 , @xmath54 , and annihilated by the @xmath8 , @xmath325 . and we ll give a simple description of the action of @xmath8 , @xmath326 , on @xmath324 , basically involving gaussian composition of forms .",
    "@xmath324 will be the image under @xmath156 of the mod 2 reduction of a certain additive subgroup of @xmath67 $ ] .",
    "this subgroup consists of expansions at infinity of certain weight 1 modular forms of level a power of 2 , and is stable under the action of a `` characteristic 0 , weight 1 '' hecke algebra . in defining the subgroup and analyzing the hecke action",
    ", we will however avoid the classical language of binary theta series and gaussian composition , and instead work with a certain equivalence relation on the ideals @xmath327 of @xmath328 $ ] of odd norm .",
    "we call this relation `` gauss - equivalence '' , and the corresponding equivalence classes `` gauss - classes '' .",
    "each @xmath327 of odd norm has a generator @xmath329 with @xmath330 odd , and this generator is unique up to multiplication by @xmath331 .",
    "when we speak of an ideal @xmath332 , we ll assume @xmath333 has the above form .",
    "[ def3.1 ] @xmath332 and @xmath334 are gauss - equivalent if there is an integer @xmath335 such that , in @xmath328 $ ] , @xmath336 .",
    "evidently @xmath335 is odd , and gauss - equivalence is an equivalence relation . if @xmath337 and @xmath338 are gauss - classes , all ideals that are products of an element of @xmath337 and an element of @xmath338 are gauss - equivalent .",
    "the semi - group of gauss - classes that we get in this way is a group , with the inverse of the class of @xmath332 being the class of @xmath339 .",
    "we call this group the gauss group .",
    "[ theorem3.2 ] the gauss group is cyclic of order @xmath340 . if the norm of @xmath327 is @xmath341 , @xmath327 generates the gauss group .",
    "the @xmath340 ideals @xmath342 , @xmath343 are obviously inequivalent .",
    "suppose @xmath344 .",
    "choose @xmath335 in @xmath345 so that @xmath346",
    ". then @xmath347 is congruent , mod @xmath348 , to some @xmath349 , with @xmath350 , and so there are just @xmath340 gauss - classes .",
    "suppose @xmath351 has norm @xmath352 .",
    "then @xmath353 .",
    "so @xmath354 , @xmath355 , @xmath28 , and in particular @xmath356 , @xmath357 .",
    "so @xmath358 is nt equivalent to @xmath359 , and the class of @xmath332 generates the group .",
    "now the ideals in the principal gauss - class are just the @xmath360 with @xmath330 odd .",
    "the proof of theorem [ theorem3.2 ] shows :    [ corollary3.3 ] there is a unique gauss - class @xmath361 of order 2 ; the ideals of @xmath361 are the @xmath362 with @xmath330 and @xmath363 odd .",
    "( we ll denote this class of order 2 by @xmath364 . )",
    "[ def3.4 ] if @xmath361 is a gauss - class , then @xmath365 in @xmath67 $ ] is @xmath366 , where @xmath327 runs over the ideals in @xmath361 .",
    "remark each @xmath365 is in fact the expansion at infinity of a weight 1 modular form of level a power of 2 , with character @xmath367 , but we wo nt explicitly use this fact .",

    "now let @xmath17 be a prime @xmath370 .",
    "then there are just two ideals of norm @xmath17 in @xmath328 $ ] .",
    "call these @xmath72 and @xmath371 .",
    "[ theorem3.6 ] @xmath8 takes @xmath365 to @xmath372 .",
    "suppose first that @xmath72 and @xmath371 are inequivalent , so that @xmath373 and @xmath374 are distinct classes .",
    "fix an odd integer @xmath22 .",

    "denote the number of ideals of types ( 1 ) , ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) by @xmath377 , @xmath378 and @xmath379 .",
    "there are evidently @xmath379 ideals of type ( 4 ) .",

    "now the ideals of norm @xmath386 in the class ( that includes the elements of ) @xmath373 are of two types :    1 .",
    "ideals prime to @xmath72 2 .",
    "ideals divisible by @xmath72    @xmath387 sets up a 11 correspondence between the type ( a ) ideals and the type ( 1 ) ideals of @xmath361 , while @xmath388 sets up a 11 correspondence between the type ( b ) ideals and the type ( 3 ) ideals of @xmath361 . so the coefficient of @xmath383 in @xmath389 is @xmath390 , and similarly the coefficient of @xmath383 in @xmath391 is @xmath392 .",

    "the elements of the maximal ideal of @xmath670 act locally nilpotently on @xmath5 , and it follows that each @xmath8 , @xmath9 , acts locally nilpotently on @xmath5 .",
    "theorems [ theorem5.3 ] and [ theorem5.5 ] tell us that when we complete the hecke algebra generated by the @xmath8 acting on @xmath5 , with respect to the maximal ideal generated by the @xmath8 , then the completed hecke algebra we get is just the non - reduced local ring @xmath670 .",
    "nicolas , jean - louis , and jean - pierre serre ( 2012 ) . `` formes modulaires modulo  2 : lordre de nilpotence des oprateurs de hecke '' .",
    "comptes rendus mathmatique 350(78):343348 . doi:10.1016/j.crma.2012.03.013 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 in @xmath1 $ ] be @xmath2 , @xmath3 and prime to @xmath4 . </S>",
    "<S> let @xmath5 be spanned by the @xmath6 , @xmath7 and prime to @xmath4 . </S>",
    "<S> then the formal hecke operators @xmath8 , @xmath9 , stabilize @xmath5 , and it can be shown that they act locally nilpotently . </S>",
    "<S> we show that the completion of the hecke algebra generated by these @xmath8 acting on @xmath5 , with respect to the maximal ideal generated by the @xmath8 , is a power series ring in @xmath10 and @xmath11 with an element of square @xmath12 adjoined . </S>",
    "<S> this may be viewed as a level 3 analog of the level 1 results of nicolas and serre  the hecke stable space they study is spanned by the odd powers of the mod @xmath13 reduction of @xmath14 , and their resulting completed hecke algebra is a power series ring in @xmath15 and @xmath16 . </S>"
  ]
}
